review_text: Super modern hotel in a really good location.The rooms are why this hotel is so good. They are modern, large, comfortable and very quiet. The technology that runs them is great, though a bit annoying with all the light it puts out - impossible to get the room pitch black. Bathrooms are fabulous. The spa pool is lovely with great views over Milan. I would recommend them having hours for kids to be able to use the pool, quite frustrating that they don't allow kids at all.Breakfast was decent but over priced. Other guests obviously felt this way too as we were the only ones ever there and the 6-7 waiters just hung around.

Returned to Milan for the first time since the pandemic. Have always loved Armani for it's fantastic location, service, amenities, and overall aesthetic. Staff are lovely and helped arrange same-day dinner reservations at Michelin star restaurants, as well as a in-room Covid test prior to departure. The rooms are starting to show their age in terms of wear and are starting to feel a bit dated/stale, as would be expected after 10 illustrious years. The room control system is excellent, but the televisions could be larger, with better resolution and an easy way to cast content from a device. Armani Ristorante is one of my favorite spots in Milan for drinks/dinner, but unfortunately was closed due to Covid. Despite the small gripes, it remains one of my favorite places to stay when in Milan. Hopefully will undergo a small refresh or renovation in the near future, like the Park Hyatt Milan (my other favorite) is currently undertaking.

The hotel is beautiful as one would expect, what made the difference were the receptionists etc. who were very helpful and kind. I was feeling unwell when I checked out and was so impressed that the person on reception arranged a bottle of water to be waiting for me when got to the ground floor

One of the best thought out suites we have ever stayed in. PLUS we got upgraded to a higher level of suite and we are rarely upgraded, even on Centurian program,. The room was controlled by an ipad that was instantly understandable. no training needed. Every one made us feel welcome and could not do enough for us.the heated floor in the bathrooms were amazing.Restaurants and bar seemed ok but we had lots of plans in Milan and we did not use them. comp breakfast was fine.

review_title: A very Merry Christmas  for someone who isn‚Äôt a Christmas person üòÉ
review_text: My third visit and everything is just as excellent as before. I am not a fan of Christmas so wanted to get away from the nonsense for a few days - how wonderful to not have decorations everywhere. I have to call out the management and staff in the Armani ristorante and bamboo bar for once again dealing with my vegan diet so gracefully. Simply but exceptional quality food. As I‚Äôm interested in design I asked to see one of the hotel suits and the reception staff were more than happy to show me around and answer my questions. What a pleasure! The spa pool and gym are very comfortable and feel welcoming to me, not too big and imposing and the staff are friendly whilst being very respectful of your privacy - I really like that approach. I feel very comfortable here and I think that I‚Äôm going to keep coming back. It‚Äôs a place in which I can truly relax, where I feel that I fit in, and where my  expectations are always met.Thank you to all the staff.

arriving to the hotel door doesn‚Äôt take you to reception/ lobby, you have to take an elevator and there was no guidance ( people or sings). we just guessed it. before coming, i have made more than 2 calls and 3 emails regarding a special request regarding my rooms ( to have them all next to each other), the receptionist was not informed and handed me cards of random rooms that are on the same floor. the receptionist did not offer to take us to the rooms, she just handed the cards which was a bit strange for such a hotel, so i asked her to. we had a 1 hour wait time in one room until the room issue was resolved. we have to take 2 elevators to get to our rooms or exit.check in area is pretty compact, so every time i passed by there was be a group of people standing waiting for their turn.  one guest with me had a " handy man" walking in on him while he was sleeping, with the do not disturb sign on the door. the hotel apologized verbally. i expected a fruit basket at least and a hand written card. strange again.room service was not a constant quality. one time i got my risotto undercooked and one time the pepper dispenser was empty. on the other hand, hotel staff were rather friendly, understanding and attentive. all my other requests were met perfectly. i was extremely happy with the wifi and the ipad controlled room. also the television had many channels from many origins.i have seen negative comments on house keeping but i faced nothing. all was great.

When you enter the hotel, you are greeted cordially, your luggage is whisked away and you are transported to the reception area where you are welcomed again. Check-in is easy and then you are escorted to your totally fashionably (obviously) designed room with all the modern conveniences. An iPad has all the controls for the room, the curtains puddle beautifully, the bathroom is stunning in marble with a separate shower and tub, you can even close off the vestibule for a private food delivery. The staff is attentive and remembered us whenever we came by reception with a question. The food at the restaurant was delicious and beautifully presented. We are only sorry that we stayed only one night.

Spacious room, friendly staff and housekeepers. I loved how high-tech all the amenities were and how comforting it is to get everything done through the iPad, including opening the door and ordering in-room dining. Contact was minimized to the comfort of the guests. Mini bar was constantly restocked and receptionists were very helpful with guiding us around the city for shopping and food cafes. Also, an extra +++ was the location. Everything was walking distance!

As far as I can this hotel is perfect. My bedroom was amazing, with a nice terrace and a great view. The pool  at 8th floor with the panoramic view is relaxing and astonishing. The possibility to control everything in your room with a tablet is very comfortable. the Hotel staff is kind and professional. As soon as Covid situation gets better I will go Back to Armani Hotel for sure.

review_title: Worst experience, racist staff foreigners are not welcome in Armani Hotel Milan.
review_text: Worst experience, rude and abusive staff do not stay here if your not Italian. I cannot believe I was treated like this. I even have mosquito bites from the bed sheets, room service was horrible, uncooked food and they gave me mango juice half glass or syrup only.

It is truly difficult to find a flaw in this hotel because it is simply perfect. To start with, the reservation staff was patient and courteous, they even called us before we arrived to make sure everything was alright. Then from the moment we walked in, we were greeted with kindness. Then they upgraded us to an executive suite without us even asking.It kept getting better from that moment on. The bathroom is so comfortable and spacious, the AC worked wonderfly, and the amenities covered everything from the toothbrush to everything else. The suit was smart and we were able to control everything with an eye pad. Relaxing music was always playing in the  hallways. There was a business center. The breakfast was by far the best I ever had in a hotel. Housekeeping was always fast to respond. The room service was absolutely delicious. The location is in the city center. Really, I love this hotel.

review_title: Outstanding time at Armani in Milan
review_text: Fantastic experience at the Armani Hotel in Milan.  From the moment of arrival until I left the staff at the hotel went out of their way to make my trip completely enjoyable.  Virtually all the staff recognized me by my name on each encounter.  The Jr Suite was perfect in every respect including the desk area where I needed to work for a couple of hours each day.  Restaurant at d bar were excellent  as was the fitness level.   And the location is spectacular.   Will definitely go back ASAP.

review_title: Great Milano Hotel - Very Well Located
review_text: This hotel is all you expect from Armani. Design, size of the room etc. Really enjoyed my time there. I was only disappointed by the Concierge service which was not able to help organize or reserve anything for me. A bit bad in such a great hotel.

This hotel deserves a lot more than the flak reviews you read.First time staying here for our anniversary.The hotel room is nice and comfortable. Mini bar complimentary - which is a really really nice touch.Special thanks and mention to Paolo from front desk. He was so patient with the check, trying to find us a room on a higher floor and when he couldn't, he brought us to the room allocated and walked us through the room details like lights, ipad etc. We had a small issue but he resolved it promptly and efficiently and really showed what it means to stay at The Armani - fantastic customer service! Just top notch! Thank you to the service team and front desk. We really enjoyed our stay.The only thing that we would like to suggest is an improvement of the WiFi. We stayed on the 3rd floor and the WiFi was patchy.But other than that, it was such a fantastic stay and thanks in no small part to Paolo.Stay here! Nice, central location, great breakfast and fabulous service.

What an amazing stay! Totally stylish and such a reprieve in the middle of a bustling city. The location was incredibly central, you could easily walk to all the hotspots. The Armani amenities were amazing, all the bath products, the drinks and snacks in the room, even stylish slippers. They really thought of everything! It was visually stunning and the perfect spot to enjoy Milan from!

I love everything about the Armani hotel, one week ago was my 4th time there and everything its always amazing. The service is excellent, they always think one step ahead to fulfill any wishes (even the man from the valet parking when we ask him if they had an item of personal care in the hotel or if there was some pharmacy around: he just told the housekeeping and this item was in our bathroom when we came back).  Service is great, the location is great, the breakfast, the branding with their own fragrance, creams, snacks, chocolates, etc...its perfect, one of my favorite hotel!

The team at the Armani were amongst the best I‚Äôve ever encountered. Friendly and helpful at every turn. Breakfast was truly amazing with unbelievably fresh fruit and vegetables. The room technology was cumbersome and overdone but the team was always there to help out. Overall we enjoyed our stay though I believe I would choose a bit more of a full service hotel in the future for the price point.

review_title: Everything is beautiful about this hotel except the duty manager
review_text: The Hotel is a 'go-to' place with an amazing design but it's people who do it. I want to say 'thank you' to Meghan from reception, be sure if you address her your request will be fulfilled efficiently. Restaurants have friendly and welcoming personnel but Lilia, Biagio and Pasquale are outstanding! Contrary if you don't want to spoil your mood avoid Luca with his arrogant and moody attitude and you will enjoy the property to the full!

It is not the first time we visit Milan but it is the first time in Armani Hotel, it was great that we chose this hotel, its location, quality of rooms, services and staff, everything was great, I will never forget Mr. Faisal, Mr. Simone and Mrs. Lara, and I apologize for forgetting the other names.Thank you everyone for their kindness to my children.The room type was a family suite consisting of two interconnecting rooms.

Very sleek hotel and impressive to see. The location is excellent as it is just steps from high end shopping and walkable to the Duomo. The lounge and dining area are also very modern and cool. My criticism is the rooms themselves were not very functional, specifically the bathroom. There is almost no counter space for makeup. There are not many outlets. The outlet in the bathroom didn‚Äôt work, so I had to curl my hair sitting in the floor, using the refrigerator door as a mirror. The use of an iPad to control everything seems cool initially, but became annoying to turn on the lights and turn off the TV. Armani hotel is a nice hotel, but can use some modern updates to make it more functional.

I loved everything about this hotel: the ambiance, the service and amenities. The staff is extremely attentive to your needs. At every turn was perfection! The breakfast selection was good, but prix course lunch was phenomenal. We also ordered room service for dinner, which arrived in no time. The spa offers a relaxing experience with wonderful views of the city. By far, this is one of my most favorite hotels and I will for sure be returning.

review_title: Modern luxurious stay with very friendly staff
review_text: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights to explore Milan and do some shopping. The room we got was spacious with a large terrace. The staff was extremely friendly and helped us swiftly with all questions and requests we had. The location of the hotel is great, especially since it is right next to a metro stop

My friend and I stayed at the Armani hotel for two nights and had an amazing time, I really recommend this hotel to anyone spending some days in Milano. The location was great, the service really good, the room very spacious and comfortable and breakfast incredibly good. We got amazing suggestions from the Front office team, particularly from Andrea who made us feel at home during our whole stay.

I have been staying in this hotel for a long time since I was a kid. I was considering this hotel as my home in Milano. The interiors are nice. However, unfortunately, the quality of the services has declined very sharply. They don‚Äôt provide quality services anymore. They don‚Äôt care about the small details. When we arrived to do our check-in, there was no one at the door and we had to ring the bell for someone to come and take our luggage (They operate the same as the 3-star hotels). The quality of food at breakfast is low. The SPA team refused to amend our SPA booking, they are not supportive at all. I tried to speak with the hotel GM, but they refused. I spoke to another person at the reception and he took no action. If you are looking for a high-standard hotel, Armani is not your choice. Armani lags far behind Bulgari Milano and other top hotels in Milano. This will be my last visit to Armani. They have lost a very loyal customer.

We stayed one night in Milan at the end of our Italy trip to catch an early flight. The hotel that we first checked into was a disaster! We talked to Luca about transferring to the Armani Hotel. He got us checked into our room quickly and effortlessly. The hotel and  room were amazing. We were so relieved and happy to be able to kick back and relax in our comfy room. The Bamboo Bar was great as well. We also enjoyed room service and a wonderful breakfast. My only suggestion would be to add more vegan options to the menus. This is a great hotel in a Milan and the staff is amazing. We would love to return one day and stay longer than one night! Thanks for making our time in Milan so enjoyable!

review_title: Greatest Experience in This Stylish and Well Designed Hotel
review_text: I stayed in Armani Hotel Milano a couple of times. As you probably know, this is one of the best hotels in Milan. Nice style, top quality, great service. If you need to book or order anything concierge would do it for you right away. Make sure to check the Armani restaurant which is on the 7th floor, great steak, pasta, deserts, wines, etc. Grazie Armani. I will be back.

review_title: Excellent in everything except in service.
review_text: Very spacious rooms and privileged location, very good taste in everything, but the problem begins with the service, I made a reservation with a corporate fee, which the attendant made the question to highlight at check-in I did not understand why.The space although beautiful is cold and does not make you feel at home, the SPA on the rooftop eh very good.The restaurant recommendation made by the concierge was basic and anyone could do it by looking at this site.

This was the most beautiful hotel I‚Äôve stayed in. Top service, amazing modern amenities I haven‚Äôt experienced in any other hotel. Perfect location.I‚Äôd 100 percent recommend this place! Everything was perfect. We controlled everything in the room with our iPad, the lights, music, shades. This is an epic hotel.

Stunningly designed hotel, with technological control in the room. Close to all the sites in the center of Milan.  An amazing team that generously responded to all our requests.  Free minibar for the entire stay including refilling every day, Late check out free of charge.  Receiving ‚Ç¨ 85 to use for extras at the hotel.  10% discount at Armani's flagship store.

I stayed at the Armani w/ my family in the family room (bedroom w/ a connecting room). The size of both the bedrooms and bathrooms were great. The hotel is first class but the service they provide during your stay is incredible. You never wait for any request and the staff goes above and beyond to provide great service. I would suggest this hotel over any other in Milan.

Even the hotel was once well designed, many interior parts are now worn out and don‚Äôt work well. Shame the main restaurant is closed for the whole of August so you must go outside for dinner. Hotel is on a main road so plenty of noise and does not look special compared to several similar nearby hotels. Hotel staff are amazing though

I stayed for 4 nights in an Armani Premiere Room. The internal layout is somewhat unusual in that the Reception is on the 7th floor, there is one lift going straight to that floor. To access the rooms you then take an other lift to go down to the floors with the rooms. Whilst this may be an unsual set up, it did not distract from the excellent stay. All the staff at the Hotel, Bar and Restaurant were extremely friendly and helpful, the room was spacious and well equipped, the Restaurant, as you would expect, is equally good. Altogether a fantastic experience. Ok, it is not cheap, all comes at a price but I am happy to pay for good service, and this Hotel definitely belongs into a class of its own. One of the few places that lived up to our expectations. Well done to all the staff to make this possible.

I had the most wonderful and comfortable stay. The rooms are of a good size with a big and luxurious bathroom. The Spa has a beautiful view of the city, from al areas. Jacuzzi is nice and big. Sauna‚Äôs are 1-2 persons, but multiple of them and also with a view of the city. Location is great ofcourse!

review_title: Style in the heart of Milan
review_text: A dream!All perfectly cared for in Armani style with a scent spread throughout the hotel.Top restaurant with a view of MilanWe ate very well and the choice of vegetarian dishes was very careful.Special note is the desserts served during our business meeting.

The location is the best!The ambiance and style is very Armani, simplicity at its highest level. Dining experience at the Bamboo was exquisite and the staff knowledgeable and very friendly!We will be happy to return in the future. Molto grazie a tutti! Aisha und Ariane

The Armani hotel is beautiful, modern and elegant. The service and amenities are exceptional and it is located within the best shopping district, steps from the Duomo and several good restaurants are nearby. Rooms are beautifully designed and high-tech. Highly recommended.

Staying at the Armani hotel was a wish and that wish was very well fulfilled. The hotel is sumptuous and very modern, full of incredible and sophisticated details. The staff is very friendly and attentive. The bar is an event, with great drinks and extremely delicious food options.

This was a superb stay, from beginning to end. The staff was kind, attentive, and paid attention to every detail.The drinks were 100%, and the food was excellent. Cannot say enough good things. We were there over Christmas, and the entire team went out of their way to make sure our stay was amazing. We hope to come back soon!

review_title: Armani in the heart of Milan
review_text: The concierge services at this hotel is above and beyond. Excellent staff! Great location. Lighting is a bit dark and it is hard to see in the bathroom...otherwise great experience. Wonderful breakfast buffet.

A truly luxury experience.The design of the hotel from the entrance to the smallest details was superb.We were amazed from the stuff.Everyone was very kind to assist us with everything we needed.We loved the breakfast and the amazing view from the bar to the Via Monte Napoleone. One of the reasons we love to stay in Milan.

Amazing service ,staff and decor . Great Rooms , restaurant. Location is great for shopping and dining .Staff is very pleasant with prompt attention.  I have stayed many times and each time it was great

What a great Hotel.I don‚Äôt believe there are many places like this in the world.Fancy and elegant but it cannot be any other way‚Ä¶ Armani says it all.I was impressed by the details, harmony of colours and the unique style.An unique experience.

Visited for 3 nights in November on business and cannot recommend highly enough. Location, ambiance, service, all exceptional! Well done, look forward to coming back again in the future and will certainly recommend!

Really good not to far from anything.The road is very quiet and peaceful.The staff is very helpful.The breakfast is very delicious.Perfect service and nice staff! Rooms and bathrooms were clean and decorated nicely and staff were impeccable! Would definitely return here.Perfect service and nice staff!

review_title: One of the best trip to Armani Milan
review_text: Armani Milan made our trip to Milan is one of the best trip ever..location is fantastic ‚Äî everything is in a walking distance .. I took junior suite with balcony, and it was a very nice room with beautiful view.. will visit again for sure ..

Exceptional hotel -- the service and amenities leave nothing to be desired. Everywhere you look is beautifully designed. The rooms are modern, high-tech and very comfortable. The hotel is located within the best shopping district, steps to the Duomo and the Galleria. The staff is friendly and helpful. Highly recommend!

review_title: Definitely my favourite hotel in Milan
review_text: Perfect hospitality. Sophisticated interior design and flawless service. This is my favorite hotel in Milan. I love the sleek yet modern vibe. The room, the room service, the breakfast, the turndown service, Bamboo Bar... extraordinary experience. I had a great time.

The hotel is so gracious and comfortable, our room was spacious, comfortable, amazingly well equipped and quiet. Restaurant and front desk staff were  kind and helpful, concierge service second to none. Bar and restaurant amazing. Situation so good for walking in Milan

Good and well located hotel in the centre of Milan.The personel is very friendly, even the concierge for making bookings outside the hotel. Check-in takes too much time, especialy in this Covid19 period, so identity cards and credit cards can be mailed before check-in. Check-out was fast and sufficent.

review_title: Expected better since it‚Äôs an Armani hotel
review_text: The location is perfect! Some staff can be really friendly, some staff high attitude, so in a way it‚Äôs like gambling. Breakfast is lacking varieties. Service is very good, free drinks in the minibar. Spacious bathroom, but the room could be a bit small. Willing to give you another chance when this madness is over. ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

Nice rooms, with lots of room. Very tidy and modern for Italy. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Bit of a walk from the main hub of the resturants but not too bad. Loved the Ferrari Factory. Thanks.

My 2nd stay at the Armani.The service is now top notch.Staff are friendly, service oriented and everything requested is attended to promptly.Our big big thanks to Paolo from frontdesk.From check in to attending to our queries and even a minor issue we had - everything was done with a smile and resolved quickly and promptly. Paolo deserves 10 stars!Thank you Armani and Paolo, for such service and a great experience!We will be back!

Excellent location, remarkable service and food. Everyone was gentle and polite. We loved the privacy the hotels offers. Breakfast was great. The quality of the food amazed us!!! The desserts area was our favorite spot.

review_title: True to the Armani Design Culture
review_text: This hotel is an experience, not a booking. In the heart of the Milan fashion district it reflects the elegant design culture of Armani: minimalist, yet grand. The service was excellent while not being over bearing. The room, technology and security were excellent. The food was outstanding. It is the perfect high-end retreat while visiting Milan.

Out of many optuions, I decided to stay in the Armani hotel. It met all of my expectations, cool design, prompt service, attentive staff. Nothing to complain about, quite to the contrary. Not my first stay and hopefuly not the last one.

Everything is fine, except for the cold feel of the common areas. Maybe a little too futuristic, but there is no warmth. It's not spooky, but close to it. Rooms are comfortable, the bathrooms are great, the staff is accomodating.

I have travelled the world, and I have stayed at some of the most exclusive hotels. Hands down this is one of the best hotels. The service and accommodations were flawless. We were upgraded to a junior suit. The room was huge and the amenities were fantastic. I highly recommend this hotel. You will not go wrong by staying there. The location is also great. We can‚Äôt wait to go back.

review_title: Beautiful hotel, needs maintenance and an upgrade
review_text: Beautiful property but needs some maintenance, is starting to look old, if you have been to the Dubai property, don‚Äôt expect the same level. Food‚Ä¶ not the best, sad to say that probably one of the worst pastas I had in Milan. But definitely a great hotel. Staff is awesome!

review_title: Magnificent! Beautiful, sophisticated and well located! Magnifico! Lindo, sofisticado e bem localizado!
review_text: Extremely well located, modern, very sophisticated, with comfortable, minimalist and elegant rooms!I would say that everything is perfect and harmonious! The architecture, the comfort, sophistication, luxury, care of the staff, the services, the meals, the rooms, the pool, the gym, the gardens and the restaurant!As if that weren't enough, the hotel bar is extremely busy with beautiful people at night, serving drinks and good food, set with good music!I would say a work of art, everything perfect! Congratulations !Extremamente bem localizado, moderno, muito sofisticado, com quartos confort√°veis, minimalista e elegante!Diria que tudo perfeito e harm√¥nico! A arquitetura, o conforto, sofistica√ß√£o, luxo, cuidado do staff, os servi√ßos, as refei√ß√µes, os quartos, a piscina, a academia, os jardins e o restaurante!N√£o bastasse tudo isso, o bar do hotel √© extremamente movimento por gente bonita a noite, servindo drinks e comida boa, ambientada com boa m√∫sica!Diria uma obra de arte, tudo perfeito! Parab√©ns !

Quando siamo arrivati in albergo hanno sottolineato pi√π volte che l‚Äôalbergo √® tecnologicamente avanzato e che tutto sarebbe avvenuto dal telecomando.Peccato che quando siamo arrivati in camera l‚Äôaria condizionata funzionava a malapena e nonostante che dal telecomando avessimo messo al massimo la temperatura, questa  non si abbassava, siamo usciti e abbiamo fatto presente il fatto alla reception con preghiera di provvedere al malfunzionamento.  Infatti al ritorno la camera era anche fin troppo fredda,  e cos√¨ abbiamo deciso di abbassare la ventola sempre con il famoso telecomando, ma con nostra grande sorpresa questo non funzionava pi√π.Quindi abbiamo dovuto richiamare la reception che finalmente alle 23,00 ci ha mandato 2 tecnici per risolvere il problema, con mia grande sorpresa i tecnici hanno tolto un filo elettrico  che avevano messo nel pomeriggio per far funzionare al massimo l‚Äôaria condizionata, ma in questo modo erano consapevoli che il telecomando per regolare la temperatura non sarebbe stato pi√π in grado di funzionare.Infatti tolto questo cavo elettrico il telecomando ha ricominciato a funzionare e la temperatura si √® alzata, ma questa si √® alzata a tal punto che nella stanza ha ricominciato a far caldo, tutto era ritornato come nel pomeriggio quando l‚Äôaria condizionata non funzionava.Quello che mi rattrista sono questi espedienti malevoli di 2 tecnici che pur sapendo che la climatizzazione non funzionava hanno fatto orecchie da mercante, accompagnati anche da una ragazza alla reception che continuava a ripetere che tutto era stato sistemato e che non c‚Äôera nulla di anomalo.Notte terribile con un caldo insopportabile in camera e un risveglio con una temperatura a 27 gradi.La mattina dietro la minaccia di andare via finalmente ci cambiano camera risolvendo il problema, cosa che avrebbero potuto fare anche il giorno prima dietro le nostre lamentele e non portando avanti una condotta vessatoria e dilatoria.Finalmente siamo nella nostra nuova camera con una temperatura di 23 gradi , ma la sera al nostro ritorno in camera con grande sorpresa troviamo di nuovo che il telecomando non funzionava, questa volta non si poteva comandare niente , n√© luci, n√© tapparelle, n√© TV , n√© aria condizionata. (fortuna che la temperatura era rimasta sui 23 gradi cos√¨ abbiamo potuto dormire tranquilli).Il problema non sono  i guasti o gli inconvenienti che possono accadere, ma l‚Äôatteggiamento di tecnici e di personale che non affronta i problemi con l‚Äôadeguata professionalit√† e onest√†. Non parliamo poi dei responsabili o del direttore con cui non abbiamo potuto comunicare. Nessuno di quest‚Äôultimi si √® degnato di porci le sue scuse per gli inconvenienti accadutoci, cosa non degna di un albergo che porta il nome di uno stilista famoso e che ha messo sempre in primo piano il bon ton e la cortesia.Dulcis in fundo: Dopo la partenza mi accorgo di aver lasciato in camera la giacca e chiedo di rispedirmela al mio indirizzo, mi chiedono l‚Äôautorizzazione a pagare con la carta di credito, indispettito gli faccio presente che dopo quello che era successo forse avrebbero dovuto fare a meno di chiedere i dati della carta di credito, questa √® la loro risposta ‚ÄúPer la spedizione della sua giacca e del documento non possiamo purtroppo assumere i costi siccome il servizio viene fornito da una azienda esterna. Con il suo permesso procederemo quindi con il pagamento tramite carta di credito indicata nella autorizzazione.VERGOGNATEVI  (andate a fare un altro lavoro che questo non fa per voi)

review_title: Inaugurazione Armani Hotel Milano, Splendida Struttura!!!
review_text: Giovedi' 10 novembre si √® inaugurato a Milano il nuovo Hotel di Giorgio Armani In centro a Milano, in via Manzoni, 31. Ero presente e devo dire che questo nuovo hotel,  elegante e sofisticato rappresenta proprio lo stile di Re Giorgio. Il Palazzo √® stato egregiamente ristrutturato, ha delle bellissime Cariatidi laterali e la sera al calar del buio √® un sogno illuminato!!!.L'hotel √® dotato agli ultimi due piani nel cubo di vetro, di due strutture: al settimo piano, per chi desidera socializzare, ci sono ristorante, lounge e bar, circondati da pareti vetrate con vista mozzafiato sulla citt√† e da soffitti alti sette metri. I clienti possono anche usufruire di un ristorante di altissimo livello ed all'ottavo di una spa, aperta solo alla clientela. Un particolare, di rilievo √® l'abolizione della reception, sostituita da un lifestyle manager, che si fa carico di ogni esigenza del cliente. Un nuovo grande Albergo in Milano per una citta' in pieno movimento come sempre!. Grazie Maestro Armani per l'occasione che dai ancora una volta alla citta' meneghina!.

review_title: Armani Hotel Milano, "una Meravigliosa Esperienza Milanese"
review_text: Oggi pomeriggio ero a Milano e visto il freddo pungente, sono tornato all‚ÄôArmani Hotel per un Tea pomeridiano. Ho apprezzato molto la squisita accoglienza  che il personale riserva appena si varca la soglia d‚Äôingresso, il personale √® molto cordiale e premuroso, come un amico che ti accoglie a casa propria; sin dall‚Äôingresso l‚Äôatmosfera che si respira √®  inebriante, ma allo stesso tempo da una sensazione di tranquillit√†; sono salito al 7¬∞ piano ove si trova il Lounge Bar ed il Ristorante,  ambiente molto fine ed elegante, con vista magnifica sulla citta‚Äô di Milano, il servizio √® impeccabile  e veloce il Tea ottimo i biscottini e le mini torte anche. Un ambiente molto bello e rilassante ove trascorrere attimi in pace e tranquillit√† per poi ‚Äúrituffarsi‚Äù nella frenetica  Milano. Lo consiglio vivamente. Un ringraziamento particolare a tutto lo Staff per la Professionalit√† e Cortesia dimostrata. Gabriele M.T.

Durchgedachtes Konzept, toller Service, hochwertige Zimmer-Ausstattung und Top-Lage in der Mail√§nder Innenstadt - was will man da mehr? Das Personal war kompetent und jederzeit hilfsbereit. Alles in einem: es war ein angenehmer Aufenthalt.

UNA DELUSIONE sono venuto in questo glorioso hotel che solo il nome dovesse far pensare il meglio bh√® lasciate perdere ho alloggiato qua 4 giorni e non sono soddisfatto per nulla dei servizi che ho ricevuto , come struttura tanto di capello non si pu√≤ dire niente √® fantascientifica ma come organizzazione e cordialit√† e servizi davvero pessimi , l'ubicazione della struttura anch'essa √® buona mentre sia il ristorante che la colazione lasciano realmente a desiderare l'ambiente √® elegante ma anche troppo snob fin troppo , la stanza era arredata con belli inserti ma i vicini della camera erano fin troppo rumorosi.. I GUSTI SONO GUSTI IO NON SONO RIMASTO SODDISFATTO E VE LO SCONSIGLIO SOPRATUTTO PER IL RAPPORTO QUALIT√† PREZZO (VI CONSIGLIO IL PARK HYATT DI GRAN LUNGA SUPERIORE, HO ALLOGGIATO L√¨ A SETTEMBRE)

Despite its pure lines, the expensive materials, the bathrooms to die for, and the unique accessories, Armani is a poor travesty of a hotel. Both service and food are ridiculously bad, so much so that we had a few fits of laughter. Arriving at the hotel, the taxi driver had to bring my bag in since noone appreared to help. Suddenly, a lovely lady appraoached me and introduced herself as my'lifestyle manager', grabbed my bag, only to move it 10 feet away, and suggested we go up to the lobby. Thank god i had the insight not to accept to leave my bag downstairs. At the lobby on the 7th floor, i waited for 10 minutes up until the same lady appeared and took my passport away. Another 10 minutes and she came back to take me to my room. There were no other guests around so i cannot attribute this worst check-in ever to overwork. After the theatre we went to the lounge bar to have a bite. My friend's simple spaghetti with tomato sauce were inedible; apparently the night cook forgot the salt. As for my minestrone it was so overcooked that it had turned into mush. the next morning I checked the breakfast card: at 10 euros a plate i could have traditional muesli, special oatmeal, and cereals served with red berries. Smarter because of the previous night's culinary experience I asked room service for clarifications: traditional muesli wax kellog's out of a box, oatmeal the same. and the special cereal served with red berries was Speial K with red fruit.... No further comment needed. Dragging my own suitcase, i left as fast as possible to have a nice cappucino in a bar in via Manzoni.....

Ho passato una notte in questo splendido hotel: Armani Hotel Milano √® un vero e proprio concentrato di lusso nel cuore del quadrilatero della moda milanese.Lo staff riesce a farti sentire unica, a partire dal momento in cui vieni accolta dal tuo LifeStyle Manager (grazie mille Antonio!), che ti accompagna in camera e ti fornisce in maniera precisa e dettagliata tutte le indicazioni utili al soggiorno. Io ho pernottato in una camera Premi√®re al 4¬∞ piano con vista sul cortile interno: ampia ed estremamente curata, sono stata accolta con un omaggio di frutta fresca, molto gradita.La camera √® un concentrato di tecnologia: √® presente un Ipad da cui √® possibile controllare tutto, dall'aria condizionata, alla tv, alla musica, alle luci, alle tende, oltre che accedere a info e servizi dell'hotel. Ho dormito benissimo, il letto era estremamente confortevole e la camera silenziosa, grazie anche alla sua ubicazione. Il bagno √® molto bello, tutto marmo e specchi, corredato da morbidi accappatoi e prodotti Armani Priv√©.L'unica cosa che mi √® piaciuta meno sono i corridoi, un po' troppo bui per i miei gusti, avrei preferito un'illuminazione un po' pi√π forte. Poco dopo il mio arrivo mi sono concessa un massaggio in Spa: la Spa si trova all'ultimo piano ed √® panoramicissima! E' fatta tutta a vetrate e la vista sul centro di Milano √® davvero spettacolare! Sono presenti lettini in cui rilassarsi, una magnifica piscina, cabine per la sauna, per il bagno di vapore e un corner in cui sono a disposizione degli ospiti snack (salutari!) e bevande.Il massaggio √® stato eseguito con maestria e precisione (la mia schiena sta ancora ringraziando Mohamed!), la cabina offriva un ambiente molto rilassante, con luci e musica soffusa: un momento di grande relax dopo una settimana pesante! Ho usufruito del servizio in camera per la cena: il menu √® vario e interessante, il servizio si √® dimostrato rapido, infatti ho dovuto attendere solo una ventina di minuti, e i piatti, oltre ad essere molto gustosi, erano anche presentati con grande cura all'impiattamento. L'indomani ho fatto sia la colazione che il brunch presso l'Armani Ristorante, al 7¬∞ piano dell'hotel: anche qui le ampie vetrate offrono una vista mozzafiato su Milano, dal Duomo, al Castello Sforzesco, ai nuovi grattacieli del quartiere Isola.Ricco il buffet per la colazione e ancora pi√π ricco quello del brunch, dove sono disponibili anche ostriche freschissime e deliziose. Ottime le tartare di pesce e ampia scelta di piatti, tra cui anche alcune alternative vegetariane. Merita una menzione speciale l'angolo dei dolci (anche se chiamarlo angolo √® davvero riduttivo!), ricchissimo, super goloso e anche di grande impatto visivo. In generale posso dire che la struttura dell'hotel √® ottima: oltre alla posizione, il design, lo stile e l'eleganza la fanno da padroni... d'altronde, stiamo parlando di Armani! Ma ci√≤ che davvero fa la differenza, secondo me, √® il servizio, vero tratto distintivo dell'hotel: tutte le persone dello staff con cui sono entrata in contatto, a partire dal Lifestyle manager, ma anche il personale del ristorante, della spa, del servizio di housekeeping, si sono dimostrati molto attenti alle mie esigenze, anche anticipandole, e con un livello di attenzione per i dettagli davvero altissimo.Camere eleganti e ambienti di design, pulizia impeccabile, servizio sempre rapido ma sempre preciso e attento, altissima professionalit√† da parte dello staff, unita ad un calore mai invadente sono gli ingredienti che rendono unica e totalizzante l‚Äôesperienza presso Armani Hotel Milano.

veramente ottimo, cura dei particolari, servizi e professionalit√†; un piacevole soggiorno. Il personale e' stato professionale, facendoci sentire a proprio agio, e la posizione veramente ottima, grazie.

Mai soggiornato cosi male! Personale sgarbato, un casino raggiungere questo albergo. Non riesco a capire come un hot del genere possa offrire un setvizio di cosi basso livello.Non ci tornero' mai piu! La colazione? Da pensioncina di paese.

Ancora una volta mi sono ritrovato con grande piacere a soggiornare all'Hotel Armani. Onestamente non saprei neanche dire bene cosa, ma in generale l'esperienza complessiva √® migliorata dalla mia ultima visita. Il personale si √® dimostrato sempre di grande aiuto. Il bamboo bar offre davvero il top e grande sorpresa, il ristorante ha guadagnato una stella michelin !! Cena indimenticabile. Chiaramente non mi sono fatto sfuggire l'opportunit√† di usare la spa !! Insomma Milano per me sta diventando sinonimo di Hotel Armani. Un grazie particolare al direttore Aru che sa sempre come risolvere le situazioni.

Hotel fantastico,atmosfera da sogno e staff dell'hotel gentilissimo e professionale.Le camere spaziose ,silenziose ,ovviamente arredate nel pi√π moderno stile e design italiano.Il ristorante vanta una stella Michelin pi√π che meritata. I piatti ottimi,delicati e curati ad arte!Rapporto qualit√† prezzo pi√π che ottimo!Complimenti a tutto lo staff, gentilissimo e disponibile in ogni occasione!Super Consigliato!Torner√≤ !!

Abbiamo scelto l'hotel Armani in occasione della nostra visita a Expo. Si tratta di una propriet√† magnifica posizionata tra via Montenapoleone e via della Spiga e caratterizzata da un'eleganza in puro stile Armani. La lobby si trova al settimo piano e offre una splendida vista della citt√†, le parti comuni sono sofisticate ad eccezione dei corridoi delle camere che ho trovato troppo lugubri. La tecnologia regna sovrana, camere dotate di ipad con il quale comandi qualunque cosa, dalle luci, alle tende, alla tv e al servizio in camera. La nostra stanza si trovava al secondo piano con affaccio sulla chiesa di via Manzoni; ben insonorizzata, era spaziosa e con un bagno da favola e prodotti da bagno Armani. Minibar compreso, accappatoi di spugna, tutto per un soggiorno di lusso. Aggiungerei sky per completezza. Servizio sempre presente, in camera abbiamo trovato al nostro arrivo fragole e prosecco, e colazione ottima con buffet e piatti caldi da ordinare: pi√π che cibo sembravano piccole opere d'arte. Spa accogliente e con una bellissima vista sui tetti di Milano.Un hotel in cui impera il concetto che "anche l'occhio vuole la sua parte" con attenzione al dettaglio maniacale e un servizio sorridente che riesce a stemperare un'atmosfera altrimenti anche troppo alla moda.

Booked a suite at the hotel for my honeymoon. Was pleasantly surprised with the iPad controlling the entire room, until it all broke down and went downhill from there. First night out in Milan, came back at 4AM to find everything not working from lights/TV/air conditioner. Called for assistance and the person did not even know what to do and said it was "strange" that this was happening until they did a complete reset at 4.30AM to get everything up and running. Next day same thing happened in the afternoon - spoke to the manager on duty and got moved to a bigger suite. Until the same thing happened again that same night while we were asleep and all the controls went off and I missed my flight the next morning as I was not able to open the safe and our passports were in there. Manager on duty came to the room to assist and acted like it wasn't a big deal. Well it was, and I will not be recommending this hotel to anyone visiting Milan. I've stayed in a lot of 5* hotels around the world and these sort of things do not happen in 5* hotels. Do yourself a favor and have a look at the other hotels around the Duomo. Lots of options around and you aren't missing out by not staying at the Armani Milano.

review_title: Hotel bello ma servizio molto freddo e non all'altezza
review_text: Ho soggiornato all'hotel Armani per una notte e, nel complesso, sono rimasto deluso.Al mio arrivo in taxi non c'era alcun membro del personale all'entrata, dunque prendo i bagagli, entro e si presenta una signorina che, credendo di essere spiritosa, mi dice "qui per entrare bisogna dire una parola magica: aprire la porta". Davvero incomprensibile. La stessa signorina, senza minimamente curarsi dei miei bagagli, mi conduce al primo piano alla reception, dove l‚Äôaccoglienza √® molto fredda e, per certi versi, inefficiente. La stessa signorina mi porta in stanza e tenta, goffamente, di mostrarmene le dotazioni tecnologiche: ma non riesce neppure a regolare l'aria condizionata (che era a 16 gradi!) e si giustifica dicendo che i clienti precedenti avevano chiesto di bloccare (sic!) l'aria condizionata di modo tale che non potesse essere regolata oltre i 21 gradi‚Ä¶.davvero mai sentito prima una cosa del genere. Due pasti con il room service: prezzo in linea con altri hotel della categoria a Milano (Park Hyatt, Bulgari), ma qualit√† decisamente inferiore...in particolare una pasta fatta in casa con astice e zucchine era assolutamente insipida.Semplici richieste del tipo asciugamani extra, borsa del ghiaccio etc. non vengono esaudite se non dopo reiterati solleciti...insomma un servizio a dir poco dilettantesco che diviene risibile per un hotel da quasi 1000 euro a notte!L'hotel, nel complesso, √® bello, certamente, ma molto freddo ed appesantito (il colmo per chi persegue il minimalismo!) da una tecnologia barocca, che si rivela scarsamente funzionale (pensate che nella stanza vi sono tende orizzontali e verticali, regolabili solo elettronicamente, ma non separatamente l'una dall'altra: o tutte aperte o tutte chiuse!).Non adatto a chi non vuole essere svegliato dalla luce del sole alle 6: ne entra in quantit√† industriale, nonostante il personale alla reception (rectius: lifestyle manager) dica diversamente e respinga la richiesta di un blackout alle finestre.Non ci torner√≤!

Ottimo il servizio impeccabile nell accoglienza..... Complimenti davvero sapete proprio come trattare la vostra clientela .... Location sensazionale un vero e proprio relax sono stato davvero bene dovete provarlo tutti ..... Il personale davvero accogliente e ospitale..... Bravi tutti

Sobrio, elegante,discreto, lusso in stile Armani, design raffinatissimo, stanze totalmente domotizzate e pulitissime, curate in ogni dettaglio.Ristorante stellato e lounge bar veramente di categoria con un gioco luci veramente affascinate.Spa ed area relax esclusiva e con un design all avanguardia, che seduce anche gli occhi nel ammirare lo sky line milanese.Personale molto gentile e garbato, attento al cliente ma discreto.La dimostrazione che lo stile italiano di Armani fa ancora scuola ed orgogliosamente si distacca dalla massa con una semplicit√† disarmante.

Had a chance to stay at hotel Amarni for 2 nights on the last days of January. One of a few hotel I was eager to try both for the renown designer and reviews. First of all very impressed with both the services the room.  The door-less interior design was pleasure to look at even though it needs a little swing to close it fully, and also iPad controlled multi functions were advanced. The hotel lobby services and greets in unison every single time you walk passed.Morning comes, the breakfast choices were alright. But,  unfortunately,  the services was not as attentive as I had expected. Waited 20 for my coffee,  I would blame that on the insufficient staff at the breakfast cafeteria. Otherwise, food's great.    Then two days flashes passed. After getting some last minute stuff, I had to get packing again. The guy on the ground floor,  Mr. Matthew,  was extremely patience and helpful,  whose English is excellent, in assisting in my packing and getting taxi to the airport. Matthew left us with hotel parting gift once we get on the cab, which ends our wonderful experience.Great service team by Amarni Hotel Milano.

I can't say enough about this hotel.  The clean lines, and impeccably decor has you instantly feeling as if you have arrived to a special place.  The rooms are elegant, with heated floor and towel racks, a VERY large bath, and a bed that give you the "hug" you need after a long day in Milan.   We stayed on the 6th floor.  They offered us an upgrade to a suite but found the balcony on the 6th floor worth the smaller room.  The lights and television are all programmed by iPad.  The mini-bar in the room is all complimentary and there is so much space for all of the new treats you will likely purchase here.  The staff are so attentive and speak good English. The bar is gorgeous and the bartenders really take care in making each one of their extensive list of creative, specialty cocktails.  We are in a wonderful area in Milan, close to all of the shopping, the Duomo and amazing restaurants.  Oh, and did I mention the Armani boutique is downstairs?  So is Nobu!  One of my favorite restaurants.  We will definitely be back and thank the hotel and staff for such a memorable visit!

Situata all‚Äôottavo piano dell‚ÄôHotel Armani nel cuore di Milano, questa spa offre una meravigliosa vista sulla citt√† a partire dal Duomo e Torre Velasca fino al pi√π recente quartiere di Porta Nuova con i suoi moderni grattacieli: ben visibili sono la cupola della chiesa di San Carlo e della chiesa di Santa Francesca Romana.La spa √® davvero accogliente con lettini comodi, molti asciugamani a disposizione, sauna, bagno turco e una splendida iacuzzi.Ho potuto godere di un massaggio corpo di 50 minuti, effettuato davvero bene e con consigli finali circa le terapie di mantenimento.Con un massaggio prenotato, l‚Äôaccesso alla spa ha un tempo illimitato cos√¨ da potersi rilassare per il tempo che si vuole e gustare un‚Äôottima tisana o frutta fresca messi a disposizione nel corner degli snack. Una gentile signorina mi ha poi anche offerto un t√® caldo accompagnato da ottimi biscottini.Consiglio vivamente questa spa a tutti coloro che amano Milano, a coloro che si vogliono rilassare lontani dai rumori quotidiani e a coloro che sono in visita in citt√†.

Se solo il RE vedesse quello che ho visto io... Sono tornato dopo un po di tempo visto la bella impressione avuta la prima volta ma ora ho notato Scarsa, quasi assenteAttenzione al cliente, arredamento privo di manutenzione, servizio lento dovuto dallo scarso numero di personale nonostante si sforzasse a dare il massimo. Capisco che in un 5 stelle i prezzi siano alti ma in questo caso non li reputo giusticabili.Credo che questo hotel abbia delle grosse potenzialit√† ma purtroppo non sfruttate.

review_title: uscire o non uscire? meglio restare in hotel!
review_text: Merita del tempo descrivere una gradevolissima esperienza ed onorare gli addetti ai lavori che oltre l'impegno professionale riservano gentilezza e competenza all'ospite pi√π che al semplice cliente. Meglio godersi il relax in hotel piuttosto che uscire! la spa √® favolosa ed ho gradito la cura dei dettagli, i profumi, il contesto generale dell'hotel. Come dire, tutti i sensi vanno appagati.La palestra per me √® fondamentale, inoltre, spostandomi spesso per lavoro, √® utile ed in questo caso completa per le mie esigenze.A presto

Un graditissimo regalo di compleanno: un giorno presso la Spa dell'Armani Hotel a Milano. Al mio arrivo il check-in √® rapido e cortese, compilo un modulo sul mio stato di salute e vengo accompagnata nello spogliatoio. L√¨ trovo tutto il necessario per la mia giornata: accappatoio, ciabatte, asciugamani, etc. Infilo il costume (l'unica cosa che vi dovrete portare, perch√® tutto il necessaire da bagno lo troverete l√¨) e vengo accompagnata nella Spa.- Ambiente: elegante, minimal (so Armani!) con una vista sul centro di Milano. - Personale: molto cortese e professionale. Particolarmente positivo il giudizio che posso dare della terapista che mi ha fatto il massaggio: un ottimo massaggio decontratturante, molto brava, cortese ma al tempo stesso non mi ha messo a disagio con dell'eccessiva referenzialit√†. Unica milgioria da poter fare: entrata nella Spa non ho ricevuto alcun suggerimento su sauna e bagno turco. Ho scoperto da sola che ci sono delle mono cabine, ma √® stato spiacevole dover aprire tutte le porte (a specchio, non si pu√≤ vedere all'interno senza aprirle) per saperlo.  - Relax: in una Spa √® fondamentale il silenzio, e qui non √® mancato. Dopo il messaggio sono rimasta per un paio d'ore da sola, con la Spa tutta per me, idromassaggio compreso!Nel complesso, direi un'ottima Spa. Piccola, ma di lusso.Per chi si vuole coccolare...

review_title: Great place - great hotel - great staff
review_text: Wir reisen sehr viel (privat und gesch√§ftlich) und sind nun auch schon mehrere Male im Hotel Armani Milano gewesen (wie auch im Armani Hotel Dubai). Staff, das Geb√§ude, die Zimmer, das Design, die Einrichtung - einfach alles TOP. Ein pers√∂nlicher Lifestyle-Manager bem√ºht sich um den Gast, und erf√ºllt alle W√ºnsche (und wir haben nicht selten sehr ausgefallene W√ºnsche).Die Zimmer sind top eingerichtet, das Design von A bis Z durchdacht und aufeinander abgestimmt. Auch die Zimmergr√∂ssen sind f√ºr mail√§nder Verh√§ltnisse sehr gut (ab 50m2). Der Preis ist, verglichen mit anderen Hotels in Europa/USA/Mittlerer Osten) vertretbar, vor allem aber f√ºr mail√§nder Verh√§ltnisse gut.Zum Schluss noch ein Kommentar zu den negativen √Ñusserungen bez√ºglich Design und Ambiente anderer Kritiker: besucht man ein Armani Hotel, so sollte man nicht davon ausgehen, opulente, dekorverh√§ngte Zimmer im Louis XIV Stile vorzufinden. Tut man dies trotzdem, sollte man sich nicht √ºber das Design und die Architektur √§ussern.Ich habe mich nicht von den zum Teil (unangebrachten) negativen Kritiken nicht beeinflussen lassen - und dies hat sich ausbezahlt. Jeder unserer Aufenthalte war perfekt. Das Hotel kann locker mit den f√ºhrenden Hotels weltweit aufnehmen.

review_title: Be VERY careful of your belongings....
review_text: On a trip to Milan a few weeks ago, we spent a night at the Armani Hotel.  Some money - a significant amount - was stolen from our room. We unfortunately only realised after unpacking at our next location.Whilst the manager was responsive at the start, after I reported the matter to the police he seemed to suggest that it was our fault.  Perhaps we could have been more careful, but this does not excuse the behaviour of untrustworthy staff. Needless to say, we did not hear from him after our return home.    I would have expected a better level of follow up service from a well reputed establishment like this.   When we eventually called the Armani Hotel for an update ten days later, the manager suggested that we could tell our insurance company that we will take our business elsewhere if they were unhelpful.    I would apply the same attitude back to The Armani Hotel ‚Äì I will most definitely take my business elsewhere in the future.

Ogni anno mi piace tornare in questo hotel di charme, dove regna un atmosfera unica.Gli ambienti sono arredati con stile minimal ma di classe, si vede l'impronta di re Giorgio, luci soffuse e un inebriante profumo che si pu√≤ cogliere in ogni ambiente. Il personale alla reception √© gentilissimo e professionale. Le camere sono tutte bellissime se vi piace lo stile inconfondibile di Armani con i suoi materiali e le sue tinte tenui. Dotate di ogni confort, spaziose con tutti i servizi centralizzati in un supervisore demotico (laptop). Tra l'altro noi quest'anno abbiamo avuto una splendida sorpresa, un upgrade sulla nostra camera. Ci hanno assegnato una signature suite, semplicemente fantastica. La cena al ristorante √© stata stupenda, abbiamo mangiato davvero bene. Siamo poi stati nella lounge del bar Bomboo ed anche qui abbiamo trovato un atmosfera davvero unica. Rinnovo i complimenti a tutto lo staff e spero di tornare presto a soggiornare in questa struttura unica nel suo genere.

A totally unique experience in every respect. I was expecting a light and airy interior and was initially surprised by the almost church like reserved colour pallet and minimal d√©cor - after a short while I totally fell in love with it ! - All staff were extremely polite - there was no pretention just courteous, attentive and sincere service. Being vegan I was a little concerned that food options could be limited, however the Bamboo Bar staff were genuinely delighted to help. Nothing was too much trouble. I am fortunate in having stayed in a significant number of 5 star hotels over the years - often with business travel - this one beats all other hands down. The spar is unique, with a Jacuzzi pool with panoramic views of the city. Interesting that the Armani brand is capable of extending its exceptional clothes ascetic to interior design AND service values. I slept over 9 hours one night which for me is almost unheard of - a good sign !We also visited the Armani Silos museum which similarly has my highest recommendation. Opera fans will love the fact that La Scala is only 3 minutes' walk away.  Dogs are also warmly welcomed which was great to see. Will definitely be back to stay when next in Milan. Thanks to all staff at the hotel for a wonderful and memorable visit ! Now want to try their property in Dubai !

Siamo veramente al top: per la cortesia, la pulizia, lo stile...Per quanto riguarda i massaggi, un'esperienza unica di professionalita' e tecnica.Chi ama le SPA non puo non vivere questa esperienza!Congratulazioni!

review_title: Impeccabile eleganza nella forma e nella sostanza
review_text: L'Armani Hotel ha superato le nostre aspettative sotto ogni aspetto.A parte la posizione centralissima la struttura √® modernissima e di una raffinatezza quasi tangibile che pervade ogni angolo,dalla hall,a tutti gli spazi comuni,fino ad arrivare alla cortesia del personale sempre pronto a fornire con la massima disponibilit√† ragguagli,spiegazioni di ogni genere e cartine!E non si pu√≤ dire che non abbiamo avuto bisogno di supporto!A partire dall'ascensore che si aziona con una card sovrapposta ad un lettore apposito,nella stanza la domotica pi√π avanzata la fa decisamente da padrona,e non √® immediato orientarsi nei meandri avveniristici di tecnologie cos√¨ avanzate quando in casa si hanno ancora gli interruttori anni '60 e le lampadine che si avvitano!La nostra suite era superba e dotata di un ipad per gestire la zona living e di un altro ipad per la camera da letto.Una composizione di sei cioccolatini con la "A"di Armani era solo il preludio di un ambiente dove tutto era elegantemente griffato senza cadere mai nel pacchiano.Faretti a profusione e stile minimal chic sui toni del bianco,nero,grigio argento,e diverse sfumature di beiges caldi e freddi,soprattutto nel bagno dalle dimensioni padronali: 2 lavandini,una vasca da bagno incastonata nel marmo e zona doccia e sanitari allestiti in due stanze parallele separate da vere e proprie porte.Molto sostanzioso il kit di cortesia in dotazione della toilette e davvero pratica l'idea di apporre un appendiabiti in bagno in aggiunta alla canonica cabina armadio.Direi sia inoltre l'unico albergo dove abbia mai soggiornato in cui il fornitissimo frigobar poteva essere gratuitamente "saccheggiato"dagli ospiti.Ho usufruito del servizio in camera per colazione,che √® stato celere,come quando ho contattato la hall perch√© non riuscivo a capire come chiudere una finestra!La mia amica ed io ci siamo concesse anche un rigenerante e lunghissimo massaggio di 80 minuti nella blasonata spa all'ottavo piano con vista mozzafiato sulla citt√†  e non ci siamo private di un corroborante bagno nella piscina riscaldata, che troneggiava imponente in una silenziosa,vasta sala con lettini,riviste ed assortito angolo tisanerie.Con piacere spendo parole lusinghiere anche per la professionalit√† dei massaggiatori,capaci di individuare una contrattura con un solo tocco della mano.Molto gentilmente la direzione ci ha concesso un late ceck out di un'ora senza sovrapprezzo e finora l'Armani Hotel √® stato l'albergo di lusso di Milano,che maggiormente ha incrociato il mio gusto.La prossima volta vorrei provare anche il Bamboo bar e il ristorante stellato.

Un nome una garanzia.....l'hotel pi√π curato ed organizzato che in Italia abbia mai visto una spa da sogno con vista panoramica bellissima .....camere ampie spaziose ed ultra tecnologiche....potrei definirlo l'hotel del futuro ....come sempre ARMANI da spunto a tutti gli altri

All‚Äôottavo (e ultimo piano) dell‚ÄôHotel Armani di via Manzoni, troviamo la Armani Spa. Una piccola piscina di acqua riscaldata a 32 gradi centigradi sui tetti di Milano all'interno trovi una vasca di acqua riscaldata a 32 gradi centigradi sui tetti di Milano dove si gode del panorama, bellissimo sia di giorno che di notte. La piscina non √® altro che un maxi idromassaggio , oltre ad avere anche il bagno turco e la sauna e anche da l√¨ vista spettacolare... Dopo un massaggio da 80 minuti ti senti davvero in paradiso, il personale √® davvero professionale e anche molto accogliente, ti senti gi√† la prima volta un vecchio cliente.... Da provare assolutamente.... Complimenti a tutto lo staff

Very good hotel, nicely located, with very good staff very well dressed and nice aroma around all the hotel, the food is fabulous, the rooms a bit tiny, with very nice decoration in the room and whole hotel

review_title: L'eccellenza made in Italy a Milano
review_text: In questo fantastico location in centro a Milano puoi non solo dormire a 800 euro a notte ma goderti una colazione o un aperitivo nel fantastico e panoramico bar/ristorante all'ultimo piano.Colazione 40 euro per 2 persone ma con un servizio impeccabile e una serie di briosche in degustazione.L'aperitivo 20 euro ma con tanti piattini che ti servono al tavolo.ambiente sublime ed elegante

Pur non essendo clienti dell' hotel soggiorniamo spesso nella bella Spa.Location d impatto, moderna e di stile.Il personale √® molto preparato e gentile e i servizi proposti sono ottimi.Il problema √® uno solo: se io prenoto un entrata alla Spa con annesso massaggio e trattamento viso, arrivo e c √® troppa gente quindi non ci sono lettini disponibili e devo stare su di un cuscino contro il muro, gli armadietti delle donne sono tutti occupati e i vestiti di mia moglie vengono portati in ufficio (....), finito il massaggio sto aspettando il trattamento viso ma si sono scordati di prenotarlo perci√≤ non se ne fa nulla.........ecco l√¨ mi arrabbio.Non √® il prezzo che ho pagato, avrei pagato anche il doppio, ma se io pago per un servizio PRETENDO di avere un servizio non la fiera di paese.All' Armani Spa PRETENDO di avere un servizio da ARMANI SPA non da becera Spa di periferia. Fatemi pagare anche di pi√π non mi interessa, ma datemi un servizio all' altezza!

La struttura straordinaria. La camera comoda e spaziosa. Il servizio impeccabile. Il bar e la (piccola) spa rilassanti e molto suggestivi. Se proprio un appunto (minuscolo) si deve fare, allora ... la pulsantiera degli ascensori!

Nell'istante in cui si varca l'ingresso principale...vieni catapultata in un ambiente dove tutto sembra muoversi a rallentatore, dove vieni avvolta da odori e profumi inebrianti e coccolata da professionisti sempre sorridenti e garbati. La Spa, ultimo piano di questo meraviglioso hotel, √® il luogo ideale dove rifugiarsi dimenticando il mondo fuori, viziarsi e rigenerarsi.

Abito a Milano. Perci√≤ non conosco l'albergo ma molto volentieri ,frequento la SPA Armani. Preferisco andare al mattino, trovo meno gente. Ottimo trattamento corpo/viso. Come operatore preferisco Fabrizio. Un osteopata, sa abbinare diverse tecniche di massaggio diverse anche molto simili a quelle craneosacrale. Prima o dopo il massaggio si pu√≤ usufruire  della SPA : piscia-idromassaggio, sauna, giacchio tritato , tisane, frutta fresca. Un bellissimo posto per rilassarsi in citt√†.

√à sempre un piacere ritornare all' Armani, personale gentilissimo, accoglienza calorosa, il luogo ideale dove far coincidere lavoro e piacere nel cuore di Milano. Camere sempre perfette con servizi eccellenti.

Hotel stupendo personale gentile disponibile qualificato. Uno dei migliori hotel sicuramente su Milano. Da non perdere la spa ...eccezionale. ottima anche la ristorazione...peccato passarci solo una notte....a presto

A Milano x lavoro. Hotel lussuoso con ottimo servizio e belle camere arredate dal Re Giorgio Armani. Buon ristorante e location, bei piatti ben serviti anche i cocktails. Tra le altre cose anche comoda location x spostarsi in citta'!!! Consigliato.Alfredo

Frequento molto gli hotel per lavoro w per piacere questo √® in assoluto tra i miei due hotel preferiti del mondo. Servizio eccellente, camere spaziose, colazione perfetta, i migliori pancakes mai mangiati nella mia vita. Vi consiglio da provare le creme per il corpo presenti nel set, sono sublimi e purtroppo non in vendita!

il nome √® una garanzia ! raffinato, elegante, pulito, silenzioso ! un altro livello.... finalmente un hotel a Milano dove si respira una qualit√† superiore alla media ! Hotel qualit√†/prezzo... lo consiglio !

Sicuro di trovare la qualit√† Armani ho soggiornato in questo hotel apprezzando tutto. Ogni dettaglio √® perfetto. I prodotti da bagno (rigorosamente Armani) sono solamente una delle tante cose che sarebbero da menzionare. Il personale √® preparatissimo, la zona √® centrale, la pulizia √® maniacale. Tutto insomma merita. Il prezzo √® pi√π che congruo per la qualit√† percepita.

Etablissement tr√®s bien plac√©, aux prestations remaquables. D√©coratio, accueil propret√©, restauration sont irr√©prochables et la vue du lounge bar est unique. Un √©tablissement incontournable √† Milan. Bravo Armani Hotel

L'Armani hotel √® sicuramente un'esperienza da provare, ad iniziare dalla sua struttura non classica della reception che non si trova all'ingresso dell'hotel. Ha tantissimi pregi tra cui la cura del dettaglio e la raffinatezza dello stile Armani che si nota in qualsiasi oggetto o pezzo d'arredamento. La SPA all'ultimo piano vale l'intero soggiorno. Unica nota critica (per questo no 5 pallini Tripadvisor) il personale in generale che non √® ancora all'altezza di un 5 stelle lusso, alcuni di loro sono perfetti ma altri devono "studiare" cosa sia un 5 stelle e la gestione dell'ospite. Il personale ed il management di un hotel devono essere scelti con criteri diversi da quelli di una boutique. Sono sicuro che nei prossimi mesi diventer√† una delle strutture di punta di Milano.

El hotel se encuentra en la zona turistica de la ciudad, a unos pasos de la via monte napoleone, y el edificio ya por fuera promete mucho. Cuando uno entra, queda deslumbrado. El trato del personal es excelente, el bar tiene una variedad enorme de tortas y muy buen cafe, y las habitaciones no solo son enormes, sino que son completamente insonoras y con todas las comodidades y amenities de un hotel de esta categoria.

Its a real 5 stars hotels, impacable service, perfect location for shopping, walkimg distance to duomo, next to metro station. All people in the reception are well trained as concierges.I loved to be able to control curtains, lights, tv from the ipad.The turndown service very good too.

great- fantastic hotel. the room have everything what you need to relax and to sleep .Bathroom just perfect fore al you needs ,very luxury.- personal : perfect and friendly all the time. the restaurant absolute the top -spa unbelievable internet - tv working outstanding      tv-internet a dream to work with.

Il miglior hotel del mondo.Ci sono andata ed √© stato fantastico.Il servizio √© stato ottimo e le camere erano bellissime.La SPA era magnifica e la palestra non era da meno.Il cibo era fresco e squisito.Credo che ci torner√≤ quest estate(o forse ci far√≤ un pensierino per Natale) con il mio Lorenzoüíè

I stayed here for a couple of nights in the summer. This is a seriously classy hotel. I loved everything. Perfect location in the fashion district but also for the centro storico (for which I mean the Duomo and the Castello really....). This hotel makes an immediate impact. Very good doormen and reception staff, classic Armani fragrance the minute you walk through the door fills your senses, wonderful classic lines and clean architecture. The rooms are a little dark and on the smaller side but go with it. They are ultra modern but so quiet and private. Everything controlled with the IPad. They have the best slippers and toiletries. I'm gushing I know! Sorry. One minor negative is that I really dislike a hotel where reception is not on the ground floor and is an elevator ride away. I got over this peeve though. I loved the Armani Bamboo Bar looking over the rooftops of Milano. This is a secret gem of a bar! For me, this is only comparable with one other hotel I've stayed in - the Upper House in Hong Kong. I intend to come back. Ci vediamo presto.

Solitamente si dice che per rilassarsi bisogna allontanarsi dalla citt√†..b√® in questo caso c'√® l'eccezione che conferma la regola, sono venuto qui con amici che sono venuti a trovarmi dall'estero ,ho subito deciso di portarli in questo hotel,√® fornitissimo di ogni tecnologia , la cucina √® molto curata e gustosa ( cosa molto importante ) in p√¨u c'√® anche la Spa sul personale siamo stati soddisfatti per la cortesia che ci hanno riservato ,sicuramente da tornare sia per scopi professionali che privati..la scena √® garantita.

Needless to say of the location,its a great excess, but,stepped into a lobby lounge with a strongly  smell of a dirty water was not a very sophisticated welcoming,and I thought,perhaps,its only because of a journey that sometimes make you feel out of your sense,but again ,after being lead to the room,was another unmistakably smell of a cheap disinfected in the corridor,am I in the wrong place?I mean...Being ArmaniThe personnal are not very professional compared to a 5stars standard,of course they do them best but only the best of what they know,they do urgently needed a real team of professional management.As it is,its seems like a B&B,and not even a good one,lack of class and professionality,its not enough the clean line of a uniformed or a Zen atmosphere,all personnal seems just a trainees,perhaps being an individual hotel its does give its  problem like many others hotels in Italy.The roomThe layout of the room may not be as elegant as armani cloths, even lifeless ,the furniture and the lightning are a bit too dark,the bathroom are the whole world apart and its absolutely meant to be for a beautiful peoples,even though its delivered its function Breakfast at the topThis is the best of the stayed,with a panoramic views of the city and a good selections of buffet,the food here is good as well as in the Bamboo bar which's the other corner of the room.In all,is not too bad a place,its just need  the right direction and its time, it could become an elegant,well groom,an well mature as Mr.Armani himself

Ho organizzato un aperitivo con alcuni colleghi della mia azienda. Nulla da eccepire sugli ambienti, il servizio e il garbo del personale...sfortunatamente i cocktail non erano eccellenti (da 18 euro) e ho trovato il finger food eccessivamente scarno e non particolarmente creativo.

Well, it's like a fashion magazine when I've got inside, the lobby, the elevator, marble was everywhere, it makes the space amazingly glittered.But... it was cold, the service is over exagerating the "marvelous" cocktail, 20 minutes to make a tomate-mozarella when there is only 3 clients, and the bread is dry! "I am sorry" is all they can do for you.But when I saw the bill, I felt sorry for myself to be in such a joke.Don't waste you time, get inside, take some pictures, and get out!

This is the third hotel I have stayed in Milan, I have written reviews for Park Hyatt and Mandarin Oriental previously. This was also the first time I drove myself to the hotel rather than having a chauffeur service. The hotel is on a busy street so they have a small lay-by for maybe 2, max 3 cars, I was luck that it was not busy so we were able to pull up. The bell-hops were very quick at unloading my car and getting our bags and we went up to the lobby on the 7th floor. The interiors were ultra luxe, minimalist chic, well dressed staff and almost clinical corridors. We got checked in and was shown our room. The room was dark and modern, but it has some wear and tear. Carpet was old and almost looked dirty, some of the furnishings were chipped.The room was large and the bathroom was extremely spacious, for a deluxe double room. The closet configuration was a little disjointed, the space was too small to place bags inside, so we kept our luggage outside on racks. It was nice to have a complimentary mini bar so I did not have to be charged frivolously for consuming bottled water. The bed was very comfortable, but if you want to lie on it or want to get under the sheets, you will need to get a turndown service. They have a weird fitted shiny, vinyl-like cover and zipped pillow cover (see pic), a few minute job for room service to make the bed to allow it to be used. The Spa was nice, but the pool was little more than an oversized Jacuzzi, albeit it has an amazing view of the city compared to Mandarin, which was in the basement but that was a proper lap pool with day beds. The hotel would have better views if it did not have the louvers on the facade. Breakfast was very nice and the Bamboo Lounge (since the main restaurant is closed on Sundays) had great cocktails and food that was available was substantial. The staff were all excellent and friendly. I think if they did some minor renovations or upgrades of the carpet and furnishings, it will definitely help with their overall appearance. My only complaint will be that it was 65 euros for parking, almost 3 times the parking charges compared to the surrounding area parking garages and much more than other hotels. Regardless, all in all it was a great stay, I will just not bring a car the next time.

I've stayed in many wonderful hotels all around the world...this is my favorite for so many reasons.....Great location in a great city..Amazing buildingFantastic space.Wonderful Bar..But much more than anything else....Incredible high standard of personal service...We were so so looked after....From the moment we walked through the door...We felt like we were at home....I also think you get to know a hotel when something goes wrong...Milan In December. Its cold..and the heating in our suite wasn't working as good as it should have been.....The way we were treated the way the whole situation was handled was the best I have ever seen....On another occasion I left my phone in the back of a car that had returned us from the theatre.......The way they found my phone. Retrieved my phone and then returned it to me in a restaurant (while I was having dinner) in less than an hour ....was nothing short of amazing.....I wont mention names as that would be unfair....But thank you to each and every individual who works at The Armani Hotel in Milan.....You are a tribute to the name Armani and a tribute to the city of Milan....On behalf of Stacy and myself....Thank you...

Me hospedei por 2 noites na su√≠te cl√°ssica, e o que sempre me incomodou nos hot√©is foi o barulho (portas batendo, pessoas caminhando, vizinho conversando, carros na rua, etc) no Armani isso n√£o existe, voc√™ entra no seu quarto e n√£o escuta mais nada, isso para mim foi fant√°stico! O quarto √© de bom tamanho, pouco iluminado, banheiro incr√≠vel, enorme, um espa√ßo s√≥ para a ducha excelente, banheira maravilhosa, cama e travesseiros muito confort√°veis, os melhores da viagem (me hospedei em 9 hot√©is em setembro). Caf√© da manh√£ delicioso com muitas op√ß√µes, foi o melhor tamb√©m, bar muito animado, Staff super gentil, enfim, Hotel com um design muito lindo, adorei ter me hospedado neste hotel, localiza√ß√£o fant√°stica, recomendo muito e pretendo voltar. E principalmente n√£o esque√ßam se querem descansar a qualquer hora do dia ou da noite em sil√™ncio total este √â O Hotel.

review_title: Perfect for fans of luxury minimalism
review_text: Location: Perfect if you are a shopaholic like me.  A simple 1 min walk to Via Monte Napoleone.  From there one can simply spend the whole day shopping and strolling merrily all the way to Galleria Vittorio Emanuele II and Duomo.  It's also right next to a subway station ( Montenapoleone).  There are also many nice restaurants and bars around.  First impression: The entry is understated.  Yet one simply can't miss it.  The Armani style pops up as soon as you see the sleek design of waiting area by the elevator.  The bellboy quickly took over my luggage and I was escorted up to the 7th floor for check in.  As soon as one steps out of the elevator, the floor length window and the venetian shutter brings out the Armani aesthetic at its best.  Check in:  Welcoming, painless, almost clinical. I was then personally escorted again down to my floor.  I was very impressed with the built-in doors to the wall.  No handles, clean and sleek.Room:  I checked in to the entry level deluxe room.  Anyone who ever tried to bargain-hunt for the cheapest room category in a luxury hotel just to say "I've stayed there" has their share of horror story about getting an odd room with no window/worst noise/right next to aircon unit or elevator...etc - you fill in the blank.  Well, not this one.  The room has floor length window facing the main street.  The room was dead quiet, not just "considering its street-facing location and low-floor", it was down-right dead quiet.  The room was very well designed and surprisingly spacious. The bathroom, which comes with a nice tub right by the window, his-and-her sink, and separate shower/toilet, was almost the same size as the generous bedroom.  Connecting the bathroom and the bathroom was closet and minibar area, which was fully stocked with snacks, soft drinks, juices, and coffee. No alcohol. But did I mention it's COMPLEMENTARY? I was especially pleased with its tablet control.  It was very user-friendly. One can do anything from turning on the bathroom light to asking for an extra dental kit (which was more than your average Colgate kit-it came with 2 tubes of Marvis tooth paste and tooth brush).Bathroom amenities:  It comes with all the standard-Armani body care range all the way.  Other facilities:  All the standard-free wifi, 24 hour gym, a relaxation pool that opens form 9AM to 9PM.  Complementary breakfast was served in one of the 2 restaurants on 7th floor-the restaurant itself was just so open and bright, one can't help but getting in a good mood to start the day.  The food was delicious, but nothing to write home about.  Bottom line:  If you are into old school glamour or homey feeling, this hotel is not for you.  Try Mandarin Oriental a few blocks down the road.  If you like luxury minimalism, you will appreciate the simple and sleek design that also pays great attention to details.  From the way the vestibule is placed at the room entry to mirrors that strategically placed in the  bathroom to optically brighten up the space, it was an experience, not just an overnight stay.  I was also impressed with how the hotel allowed me to be pampered while being self-sufficient at the same time. When other properties either suffocate you with attention or hang you out to dry, I felt right at home at Armani Milan.

L'ideale per  un soggiorno davvero di lusso e qualit√† anche insieme ai vostri piccoli. Purtroppo causa luci della domotica non ho riposato bene. Amo dormire con il buio totale.Camera stupenda posizione perfetta

review_title: Superb Location, Lovely rooms, Quirky touches and Great Service
review_text: Stayed here for a work trip with a colleague for 4 nights in April 2017. The week of the exhibition we were visiting the prices were 200% up but everywhere was in the city so value for money is hard to be realistic on that wee.
